alert.note: Alert for Central Middlesex County; Eastern Essex; Eastern Norfolk; Eastern Plymouth; Northern Bristol; Northern Worcester; Southeast Middlesex; Suffolk; Western Norfolk; Western Plymouth (Massachusetts) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 10 at 1:20PM EDT by NWS Boston
info.description: ...Developing Thunderstorms Producing Heavy Rain and Minor Flooding Across the Boston Area... At 118 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a several developing thunderstorms across the Boston Metro area. These storms were moving slowly northeast at 10 mph. HAZARD...Heavy Rainfall and Minor flooding. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Minor nuisance flooding of typically flood prone areas. Locations impacted include... Boston, Cambridge, Brockton, Quincy, Lynn, Newton, Somerville, Framingham, Waltham, Malden, Brookline, Medford, Weymouth, Revere, Peabody, Arlington, Everett, Salem, Marlborough, and Woburn. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...<30 MPH
info.instruction: Get indoors when you hear thunder. Do not resume outdoor activities until at least 30 minutes after the storm has passed. Do not drive through flooded roads or underpasses. Avoid low lying areas near small streams.
